items.title: Best Streaming Service Deals to Save Money in 2025
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary: This article highlights the top current deals across leading streaming platforms like Peacock, Disney Plus, Hulu, and Sling TV, helping subscribers save money while enjoying diverse content. It emphasizes available discounts, bundles, and promotions relevant for budget-conscious viewers seeking value in 2025.

items.title: Ancestra Highlights Both Potential and Limitations of AI-Generated Film
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary: Eliza McNitt’s short film Ancestra, created with Google DeepMind’s AI tools, showcases generative AI’s ability to produce unique visuals but also reveals current technical and narrative limitations. It sparks necessary debate on AI’s impact in filmmaking, especially concerning job displacement and creative authenticity, underscoring cautious adoption.

items.title: YouTube to Integrate Veo 3 AI Video Generation into Shorts This Summer
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: YouTube will introduce its advanced Veo 3 AI video generation model to Shorts later this summer, enhancing video quality and audio incorporation. This update could transform content creation on Shorts, which already sees over 200 billion daily views, signaling major growth in AI-driven video production tools.

items.title: Death Stranding Expands with a New Animated Film Adaptation
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary: Death Stranding is evolving with an upcoming animated film written by Aaron Guzikowski, offering fresh stories within its complex universe. This spinoff precedes the release of Death Stranding 2 and complements a live-action movie, highlighting the franchise's growing cinematic presence. Fans should anticipate new creative expansions of Kojima's acclaimed world.

items.title: Which Webcams Are Compatible with Nintendo Switch 2?
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary: The Nintendo Switch 2 supports video chat with either its official camera or select USB webcams, but many popular USB-C webcams fail to work. A crowdsourced list from Reddit and tests confirm compatibility varies widely, highlighting the need for careful webcam selection for Switch 2 users.

items.title: Facebook Introduces Passkey Support to Enhance Account Security
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary: Facebook is implementing passkey support on its mobile app to strengthen security by enabling logins through biometric or device authentication, reducing phishing risks. This advancement aligns with broader industry moves to safer, passwordless authentication methods, enhancing user protection and ease of access.

items.title: How Artists Are Navigating the Rise of AI in Creative Fields
items.author: Jacob Kastrenakes
items.summary: AI technologies are rapidly transforming the arts, prompting creators to either embrace, resist, or adapt to these changes. This article explores diverse artist responses, from perfumers to illustrators, highlighting the search for balance amid AI's disruptive impact. It offers insight into the evolving relationship between art and technology, crucial for understanding the future of creativity.

items.title: NFC Release 15 Boosts Contactless Range and Reliability
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary: The upcoming NFC Release 15 standard significantly extends NFC range from 0.5cm to 2cm, enhancing device alignment and speeding up contactless payments. This update supports smaller devices and more complex interactions, offering greater convenience for users and advancing NFC technology's practical applications.

items.title: How The Roottrees are Dead transitioned from AI-generated art to hand-illustrated success
items.author: Jay Castello
items.summary: The indie game The Roottrees are Dead initially used AI-generated art but faced ethical and platform restrictions, leading to hand-illustrated replacements. This shift boosted its critical and commercial success, highlighting the complex balance between AI tools and traditional artistry in game development.

items.title: Waymo Plans to Launch Autonomous Robotaxi Service in New York City Pending Legal Changes
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary: Waymo aims to introduce a fully autonomous robotaxi service in New York City but must first change state laws requiring safety drivers. The initiative highlights challenges of navigating NYC’s dense, chaotic streets, underscoring the importance of legal and technological advancements in urban autonomous driving. This development signals a major step for autonomous vehicle adoption in complex urban environments.

items.title: Google Introduces Real-Time AI Voice Chats in Search with Search Live
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary: Google is testing Search Live in AI Mode, enabling real-time voice conversations with its AI chatbot directly in the Google app. This feature enhances search interactions by providing spoken responses and relevant links, marking a significant step in AI-driven, interactive search experiences for users in the US.

items.title: Discounts on Animal Crossing LEGO Sets and Other Tech Deals
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary: Animal Crossing LEGO sets, especially the K.K. Slider concert diorama, are now available at reduced prices, making them an ideal buy for fans. Additionally, notable deals include Motorola’s 2024 Edge phone and Apple’s latest MacBook Air, offering significant savings on popular tech products. These promotions provide excellent value for gamers and tech enthusiasts alike.

items.title: Samsung Galaxy A36 5G Hits Lowest Price with Feature-Rich Midrange Phone
items.author: Brandt Ranj
items.summary: Samsung’s Galaxy A36 5G is now available at its lowest price of $349.99, offering a large 6.7-inch OLED display, Snapdragon 6 Gen 3 processor, and six years of software updates. This affordable midrange phone combines durable build and strong features, making it a compelling budget Android choice.

items.title: Exploring AI Creativity Without Any Training Data
items.author: Franklin Schneider
items.summary: Artist Terence Broad developed a method to generate AI artwork without training on any data by looping neural networks against each other, revealing AI’s latent creativity. This innovative approach challenges conventional AI ethics and highlights the mystery and potential in AI’s internal processes beyond derivative outputs.

items.title: The Rise of Celebrity-Backed Mobile Virtual Network Operators
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary: Celebrity-backed mobile virtual network operators (MVNOs) are surging, driven by advancements like 5G and eSIM technology. Ryan Reynolds' success with Mint Mobile has inspired others, including political figures, to enter the wireless service market, reflecting a shift in branding strategies and consumer accessibility. This trend highlights the evolving telecom landscape and celebrity influence.

items.title: Govee Table Lamp 2 Pro X Sound by JBL: A Smart Light with Party Speaker Features
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary: The Govee Table Lamp 2 Pro X Sound by JBL combines vibrant smart lighting with a decent Bluetooth speaker, making it a versatile and fun addition to home gatherings. It supports smart home integration and offers impressive light effects but lacks bass depth and outdoor durability. Ideal for adding ambiance and music in indoor settings.

items.title: Framework Laptop 12 Review: A Colorful, Repairable Convertible with Mid-Range Performance
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary: Framework's Laptop 12 is a vibrant, modular 2-in-1 touchscreen laptop emphasizing repairability and upgradeability with a solid build and fun design. Despite its aging Intel i3 chip and some mediocre features, it offers unique customization options making it ideal for enthusiasts valuing longevity over raw power.

items.title: Honda Achieves Successful Launch and Landing of Experimental Reusable Rocket
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary: Honda successfully launched and landed its first experimental reusable rocket during a test in Japan, marking a significant milestone in its aerospace ambitions. The 21-foot rocket reached 890 feet and landed within 37cm of its target, showcasing advanced landing precision. This progress advances Honda's 2029 goal of achieving suborbital flights and signals a growing push in private space exploration technologies.

items.title: Summer Game Fest 2025 in LA: Gaming Amidst Political Tension and Protests
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary: Summer Game Fest 2025 offered gaming excitement shadowed by intense political unrest as ICE raids in LA ignited protests near the event. The article reveals the complex interplay of celebration and fear, highlighting the gaming community’s resilience amid social turmoil and reminding readers why this moment matters.

items.title: RFK Jr.'s Controversial Shakeup of US Vaccine Policy and Its Risks
items.author: Lauren Leffer
items.summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., leading the US Health and Human Services, has controversially overhauled the federal vaccine advisory committee, replacing experts with individuals holding anti-vaccine views. This shift threatens routine vaccination access and affordability, risking resurgence of preventable diseases and undermining public health protections nationwide.

items.title: Klarna Launches Mobile Phone Service as Part of Its Expansion Beyond BNPL
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary: Klarna is expanding beyond buy-now-pay-later by launching a $40/month mobile phone service in the US, offering unlimited 5G on AT&T’s network with no contracts and easy eSIM activation. This move highlights Klarna’s ambition to become a comprehensive digital financial assistant leveraging AI for cost-saving suggestions.

items.title: Eufy launches portable Smart Display E10 to monitor security cameras
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary: Eufy introduces the Smart Display E10, an 8-inch portable hub that monitors up to four security camera feeds simultaneously and integrates AI-powered facial recognition. It offers twice-daily event summaries, enhancing home security management. Priced at $199.99, it's ideal for users seeking convenient, versatile smart home monitoring.

items.title: Wyze Introduces VerifiedView to Restore Trust in Security Cameras
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary: Wyze has launched VerifiedView, a security feature embedding user ID into camera footage metadata to prevent unauthorized access, addressing past security breaches. This innovation strengthens user protection without sacrificing AI functionality, signaling Wyze's commitment to robust, transparent home security. It reassures users amid rising smart camera concerns.

items.title: Garmin Launches Comfortable Arm-Worn Index Sleep Monitor with Week-Long Battery Life
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary: Garmin’s new Index Sleep Monitor, worn on the upper arm, offers detailed sleep and health tracking with up to seven days of battery life, providing a comfortable alternative to wrist wearables. It tracks sleep stages, heart rate, breathing, and skin temperature, enhancing fitness and recovery insights without nightly charging.
